answerText: "Sunstone"[10] This Mexican poet wrote "Sunstone" as well as the nine-part collection of essays, The Labyrinth of Solitude.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | Editors Packet 1 | 18 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question:  In this poem, the narrator states "the magic of reflections resurrects willow of crystal, a poplar of water, a pillar of fountain by the wind drawn over." For 10 points each: [10] Name this poem better known for having 584 lines to match up with the 584 days of the Aztec calendar.
